snippet: Scientists have found human remains bearing wounds as well as a cache of weapons 2,000 years old in wetlands in East Jutland.
abstract: Team of archeologists led by Dr Mads Kahler Holst unearths a trove of ancient weapons and human remains in the wetlands of Denmark; artifacts indicate that the 2,000-year-old site was the scene of a major battle, although it is unclear what the battle was about and who the warriors were.
lead_paragraph: Scientists have found human remains bearing wounds as well as a cache of weapons 2,000 years old in wetlands in East Jutland.

headline.seo: Warrior Remains, 2,000 Years Old, Found in Denmark
